text: The 1990 USSR Federation Cup was the fifth and the last edition of the USSR Federation Cup and was officially known as Cup of the USSR Football Union. It was brief and took place between 28 May through 6 July. Its final was played at the Black Sea Steamship Central Stadium in Odessa. ==Group stage== ===Group A=== ===Group B=== ==Knock-out stage== ===Semifinals=== \---- ===Final=== {| style="font-size: 90%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" |colspan="4"| Chernomorets: |- !width="25"| !!width="25"| |- |GK || || Viktor Hryshko || || |- |DF || || Serhiy Kuznetsov |- |MF || || Yuriy Shelepnytskyi || || |- |DF || || Vasyl Ishchak || |- |DF || || Serhiy Puchkov || || |- |DF || || Oleksandr Spitsyn || || |- |MF || || Ilya Tsymbalar || || |- |FW || || Ivan Hetsko || || |- |MF || || Oleg Imrekov || || |- |FW || || Heorhiy Kandratsyew |- |MF || || Ihor Savelyev || |- |colspan="4"|Substitutions: |- |DF || || Yuriy Kulish || || |- |MF || || Yuriy Nikiforov || || |- |MF || || Serhiy Husyev || || |- |DF || || Serhiy Tretyak || || |- |GK || || Ihor Krapyvkin || || |- |colspan=3|Manager:Viktor Prokopenko |- |colspan=4| Assistant referees: |} {| cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font- size:90%;
